metadata.title: CVE-2021-3999 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in glibc. An off-by-one buffer overflow and underflow ingetcwd() may lead to memory corruption when the size of the buffer isexactly 1. A local attacker who can control the input buffer and sizepassed to getcwd() in a setuid program could use this flaw to potentiallyexecute arbitrary code and escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu1').
